Package model

Class ComputerPlayer

java.lang.Object
model.UserPlayer
model.ComputerPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Player
public class ComputerPlayer extends UserPlayer
This class represents a computer player player in a Tic-Tac-Toe game and extends the UserPlayer class. The computer player uses a five step algorithm to make its moves on the board: 1. Try to fill in tile to win the game. 2. If no tile exists, fill in tile blocking user from winning the game. 3. If no tile exists, fill in tile to get in two in a row. 4. If no tile exists, fill in tile blocking user from getting two in a row. 5. If none of these moves exist, place symbol on a random empty tile. The class overloads the makeMove() method to implement the algorithm.

  • Field Details

    • nextMove

      private int[] nextMove
      The coordinates {row, column} of the next move computer player will make. A computer move is represented by integer arrays of length two.

      public ComputerPlayer(char symbol)
      Construct a computer player player by initializing its symbol and movesMade fields.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • getNextMoveMade

      public int[] getNextMoveMade()
      Get the next move that the computer player player will make.
      Returns:
      The next move that the computer player player will make will make, or null if computer player has no next move.

    • firstMove

      public GameState firstMove(Board board)
      Make the first move of the game. Either fill up a random empty tile, or try to block user from getting two in a row if possible
      Parameters:
      board - the board to make the move on
      Returns:
      The state of the game after the move.

    • makeMove

      public GameState makeMove(Board board)
      Make a move on the board after the first turn by following the specified algorithm.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to make the move on
      Returns:
      The state of the game after the move.

    • fillRandomTile

      private GameState fillRandomTile(Board board)
      Utility method for making a random move on the board by filling up a random empty tile.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to make the move on
      Returns:
      The state of the game after the move.

    • getTwoInARow

      private int[] getTwoInARow(char symbol, Board board)
      Utility method that will get the next move that forms two in a row for the specified symbol, if it exists.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol to attempt to make two in a row of
      board - the board to make the move on
      Returns:
      The move that forms two in a row for the symbol, or null if no such move is found.

    • getWinningMove

      private int[] getWinningMove(char symbol, Board board)
      Utility method that will get the winning move for the specified symbol on the board, if it exists.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol to get the winning move for
      board - the board to get the winning move on
      Returns:
      The winning move, or null if no winning move is available.

    • getMoveCoordinates

      private int[] getMoveCoordinates(int row, int col)
      Return a move on the board represented by the the given coordinates (row and column values).
      Parameters:
      row - the row value to put in the array
      col - the column value to put in the array
      Returns:
      An int array containing the given row and col values represented as {row, column}.
